roleset.name: to mend or supply with a patch
roleset.note: PATCH-V NOTES: Frames file for 'patch' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from patch.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Although [the union-bidder]-1 expects [*-1]to patch together a substitute offer , consisting of less cash , the failure [*] to get cash from Japanese and American banks confirmed a growing fear [*ICH*-2] among arbitragers that the pageant of high-leverage takeover deals is ending .
example.arg: a substitute offer , consisting of less cash ,

roleset.name: administer an eyepatch
roleset.note: PATCH-V, PATCHING-N NOTES: Added by Julia.

example.name: patch-v
example.text: We pressure-patched the eye with a topical antibiotic ointment

example.name: patching-n
example.text: She is experiencing diplopia and sensitivity to bright light that is currently assisted by wearing sunglasses with patching of one of the lenses .

roleset.name: to mend or supply with a patch
roleset.note: PATCH_UP-V NOTES: Verb particle construction not present in VN. (from patch.02-v)

example.name: intransitive
example.text: The arbs may recoup some of their paper losses if the UAL deal gets patched up again , as they did in 1982 when Occidental Petroleum Co. rescued them with a $ 4 billion [*U*] takeover of Cities Service [*T*-1].
